column5: Finally got to spend a morning on the water with the son, so we ran out to the river to drag harnesses. I figured the waters would still be a little murky and opted for darker blades. Robert opted for bright and white. He guessed wrong. My half of the morning was great. In 4 hours I would land walleye, pike, smallies and sheephead. The highlight of the morning was another PB. Got myself a 30" pickerel. Not my heaviest, but certainly my longest. She will be coming soon to a place of honor on the wall.
Way to go bruce!!!!  Sounds like a great time!  Pics?

I'm still running an outdated old Mac that has long since been incompatible with photobucket or my camera program.  New computer is very low on my priority lists this year with all that is going on in the household..
Ah ic  Again, congrats!  Sounds like a much needed outing
Good going Bruce. You never know what the next fish will be on that river.
Sounds like a fun outing, congrats on the pb pici!
Good job Bruce. Glad your getting out and getting bit.  Cliff and I will try our best to let you catch the biggest perch this fall
I'm still hunting for that 16" that's out there.
Way to go Bruce!  And a pb to boot!  I am having Rollmops and Rosolli salad tonight and I will toast your good fortune.  Mark
Nicely done Bruce,keep looking for that big one !
Bruce your a hard worker obviously But so glad u were able to kick back and relax a bit Nice nice pickerel ? for sure
I had no idea there was good walleye fishing as close to St.Catharines (were I grew up) as there is (sans Lake Erie).  Way to go Bruce!
I had no idea there was good walleye fishing as close to St.Catharines (were I grew up) as there is (sans Lake Erie).  Way to go Bruce!  my spidey senses are tingling!
